newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand rejects mills' plea for more cheap corn.
newsitem.headline: Thailand rejects mills' plea for more cheap corn.

text.p: Thailand has shelved a request from animal feed producers for an additional 100,000 of corn imports under the zero-tariff scheme, a senior commerce ministry official said on Friday.
The official, who asked not to be named, told Reuters that the 200,000 tonnes allowed for this year would be sufficient to meet local demand.
"We decided to freeze the proposal as we do not think it is necessary to allow any extra imports right now," he said.
But should a real need emerge in the future, reflected in domestic prices, the request would be considered, he said.
Local corn output for the 1997/98 (July-June) crop year was forecast to reach 4.53 million tonnes against 4.39 million estimated for 1996/97.
Thailand this year allowed 200,000 tonnes of tariff-free corn imports on condition that local corn prices reached 4.50 baht ($1.11) a kg. That condition was met only recently.
